intro: Coldenia mitis, commonly known as the mountain ginger, is a flowering plant native to the forests of New Zealand. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers, and is characterized by its aromatic, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understorey of temperate rainforests. Its leaves are lance-shaped and can reach up to 30 centimeters in length, while its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white. Coldenia mitis is valued for its ornamental qualities and has cultural significance among Māori communities.
